beaches.name: Cala Cap Blanc
beaches.description: Rocky cove with crystal clear water

golf.intro: Moraira offers easy access to quality golf courses, with the nearest just 10 minutes away. The year-round Mediterranean climate makes it perfect for golfers seeking to escape northern winters.

courses.name: Club de Golf Ifach
courses.description: Scenic 9-hole course in Benissa with mountain views. Welcoming club atmosphere with excellent facilities.

courses.name: La Sella Golf Resort
courses.description: Championship 27-hole complex designed by José María Olazábal. Luxury resort with hotel, spa, and dining.

courses.name: Club de Golf Jávea
courses.description: Charming 9-hole course with spectacular Montgó mountain backdrop.

content.metaTitle: Living in Moraira | Property Guide Costa Blanca North
content.metaDescription: Complete guide to living in Moraira, Costa Blanca. Discover this exclusive coastal village, beaches, property market, golf courses and lifestyle information.
content.heroIntro:
Moraira is an exclusive fishing village that has evolved into one of Costa Blanca's most desirable residential addresses. Part of the Teulada-Moraira municipality, this intimate coastal community offers a refined lifestyle that attracts discerning buyers seeking privacy, quality, and authentic Mediterranean charm.

Unlike larger coastal towns, Moraira has deliberately limited development to preserve its village character. The result is an upmarket enclave where whitewashed villas dot the hillsides, a picturesque marina shelters luxury yachts, and traditional Spanish life continues in the charming center.

lifestyleSection.intro:
Life in Moraira revolves around the sea, good food, and relaxed outdoor living. The village center, clustered around a 14th-century watchtower and small fishing port, retains genuine Spanish character with traditional tapas bars, weekly markets, and local fiestas.

The international community—primarily British, German, Swiss, and Dutch—is well-established but integrated. You'll find excellent restaurants, boutique shopping, and active social clubs while still experiencing authentic Spanish culture.
highlights: Exclusive village atmosphere with limited development
Beautiful beaches including the sheltered Portet bay
Active marina with sailing and water sports
Excellent restaurants from beach chiringuitos to fine dining
Weekly Wednesday market with local produce and crafts
Safe, quiet environment ideal for families and retirees
Strong sense of community among residents
Easy access to Jávea, Calpe, and larger towns

amenitiesSection.beaches: Moraira has several beautiful beaches and coves. Playa de l'Ampolla in the center offers calm waters and beachfront dining. El Portet is a stunning horseshoe bay—one of the prettiest on the coast—perfect for families and snorkeling. Cap Blanc and other rocky coves offer secluded swimming in crystal-clear water.
amenitiesSection.dining: Despite its small size, Moraira punches above its weight gastronomically. Fresh seafood is exceptional—try the local prawns or catch of the day at waterfront restaurants. The village center has traditional Spanish tapas bars, while international cuisines are well-represented. Several restaurants are highly rated.
amenitiesSection.shopping: Moraira's center has boutique shops, galleries, and daily essentials. The Wednesday market is a highlight, with fresh produce, flowers, clothing, and local crafts. For larger shopping, Ondara (25 min) has a retail park with major stores, and Jávea (15 min) offers more variety.
amenitiesSection.healthcare: Hospital de Dénia (Marina Salud) is the nearest major hospital, about 20 km away with English-speaking staff. Moraira has medical centers, private clinics, dentists, and well-stocked pharmacies. Private health insurance is popular among expats for comprehensive coverage.
amenitiesSection.transport: Alicante-Elche Airport is 85 km (approximately 55 minutes) via the AP-7 motorway. Valencia Airport is 120 km. A car is essential in Moraira as public transport is limited. The village is compact and walkable, but accessing beaches and amenities requires driving.

content.propertyMarketSection:
Moraira's property market is characterized by exclusivity and quality. Strict planning controls have limited high-rise development, resulting in a landscape of individual villas, many with sea views. This scarcity maintains strong property values.

New build villas typically start around €800,000 for contemporary 3-bedroom homes, with premium sea-view properties ranging €1.5-3 million. Buyers are typically seeking lifestyle properties—permanent homes or high-end holiday residences—rather than investment rentals.

The hillside areas of Cumbre del Sol (technically in neighboring Benitachell), El Portet, and Cap Blanc are particularly sought-after for their views. Properties sell to a quality-focused international clientele willing to pay for the Moraira lifestyle.
whyLiveHereSection: Exclusive village atmosphere without mass tourism
Some of Costa Blanca's most beautiful beaches and coves
Strong property values maintained by limited development
Sophisticated international community with village intimacy
Safe, peaceful environment ideal for families and retirees
Easy access to golf courses and outdoor activities
Authentic Spanish character preserved in village center

faqs.question: Is Moraira expensive?
faqs.answer: Moraira is one of the more upmarket areas of Costa Blanca, with property prices reflecting its exclusivity. However, daily living costs are reasonable. Restaurant meals, groceries, and services are comparable to other Costa Blanca towns, though some premium establishments charge higher prices.

faqs.question: Is Moraira good for families?
faqs.answer: Moraira is excellent for families seeking a safe, quiet environment. The sheltered Portet beach is perfect for children, and the village has a family-friendly atmosphere. International schools are available in nearby towns. It's particularly popular with families seeking quality over nightlife.

faqs.question: What is the expat community like in Moraira?
faqs.answer: Moraira has a well-established international community, predominantly British, German, Swiss, and Dutch. The community is active with social clubs, sports groups, and charitable organizations. English is widely spoken, though learning Spanish is beneficial and appreciated.

faqs.question: How far is Moraira from the airport?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport is 85 km from Moraira, approximately 55 minutes by car. Valencia Airport is 120 km, about 1 hour 20 minutes. Both airports offer extensive international connections.

faqs.question: Are there golf courses near Moraira?
faqs.answer: Yes, Club de Golf Ifach in nearby Benissa is just 10 minutes away. La Sella Golf Resort with 27 championship holes is 25 minutes. Club de Golf Jávea is 20 minutes. All courses welcome visitors and offer memberships.

faqs.question: What beaches are in Moraira?
faqs.answer: Moraira has several excellent beaches. L'Ampolla is the main beach in the village center. El Portet is a beautiful sheltered bay, perfect for families and snorkeling. Smaller coves like Cap Blanc offer crystal-clear water for swimming. All beaches have good facilities.

faqs.question: Can I walk around Moraira?
faqs.answer: The village center is compact and very walkable. However, residential areas are spread across hillsides, and accessing different beaches requires a car. Most residents drive for daily activities. The coastal path offers excellent walks between beaches.

faqs.question: What are property prices in Moraira?
faqs.answer: New build villas in Moraira typically start from €800,000 for 3-bedroom homes. Sea-view properties in premium locations range from €1.5 million to over €3 million. The limited supply of new developments maintains strong property values.

content.conclusion: Moraira offers an exclusive Mediterranean lifestyle that combines village charm with sophisticated amenities. For buyers seeking privacy, quality beaches, and a refined international community, Moraira is an exceptional choice. Contact us today to explore available new build properties in this sought-after location.
